scenarioDescription:
The HD 109246 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 109246 is a star with 1.2 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.07 times its radius. It is located 221.25 light years away from the solar system.

HD 109246 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 109246 system


HD 109246 b

HD 109246 b was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory observatory, in 2010-11, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.33 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 109246 b is 273.480 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 109246 b is 13.900 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 109246 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 109246, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory.
name: HD 109246 - System With 1 Exoplanet
